reviews.review_msg: Good lectures, great prof.  Challenging assignments but he is willing to help.

Took years ago (pandemic) but still memorable. Handwrote all lecture notes, lecture times dedicated to much-needed practice. Accommodating deadlines; cared more about learning than pressuring. Offered 1-1 meeting to all of us to discuss course progress, grad school plans, etc. Need more profs like him; might've switched degrees w/o his 440 course.

Very accessible outside of class. Difficult homework and difficult final, but compensates for that with a change in how the grades are weighed. Best math prof Ive ever had. Made us feel like mathematicians rather than students.

Lecture notes are well-prepared since there are many examples following the new definitions and theorems. The Q&A sessions and office hours were always fairly helpful. Whenever you have some questions from the class, just go ask him and he would be willing to answer that. It is my pleasure to have Jake as my instructor this term.

Jake is a professor that is genuinely responsive to students. The amount of effort he puts in to the lecture notes and worksheets shows that although he may expect a lot from his students, he puts in just as much effort towards the course. Bi-weekly quizzes are a substitute for a midterm.
